publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3922 Mr John McAllion: United States of America Government Ban on Importation of Glenfiddich Havana Reserve Malt Whisky-That the Parliament condemns the ban by the Government of the United States of America on the Glenfiddich Havana Reserve single malt entering the United States; notes the absurdity of banning a Scotch malt on the grounds that it is matured in Cuban rum barrels; further notes that this ban highlights the absurdity and iniquity of the oppressive Helms Burton Act that seeks to punish any contact or trade with Cuba, and looks forward to closer links between Scotland and Cuba through trade, tourism and ties of friendship.
S1M-3922 United States of America Government Ban on Importation of Glenfiddich Havana Reserve Malt Whisky (lodged on 18 February 2003) Scott Barrie*, Alex Neil*, Elaine Smith*
S1M-3922 United States of America Government Ban on Importation of Glenfiddich Havana Reserve Malt Whisky (lodged on 18 February 2003) Tommy Sheridan*, Ms Sandra White*

S1M-3922 Mr John McAllion: United States of America Government Ban on Importation of Glenfiddich Havana Reserve Malt Whisky-That the Parliament condemns the ban by the Government of the United States of America on the Glenfiddich Havana Reserve single malt entering the United States; notes the absurdity of banning a Scotch malt on the grounds that it is matured in Cuban rum barrels; further notes that this ban highlights the absurdity and iniquity of the oppressive Helms Burton Act that seeks to punish any contact or trade with Cuba, and looks forward to closer links between Scotland and Cuba through trade, tourism and ties of friendship. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Alex Neil, Elaine Smith, Tommy Sheridan, Ms Sandra White, Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-3922 United States of America Government Ban on Importation of Glenfiddich Havana Reserve Malt Whisky (lodged on 18 February 2003) Alasdair Morgan*
S1M-3922 United States of America Government Ban on Importation of Glenfiddich Havana Reserve Malt Whisky (lodged on 18 February 2003) Robin Harper*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Susan Deacon*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-3922 United States of America Government Ban on Importation of Glenfiddich Havana Reserve Malt Whisky (lodged on 18 February 2003) Linda Fabiani*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3922 United States of America Government Ban on Importation of Glenfiddich Havana Reserve Malt Whisky (lodged on 18 February 2003) Andrew Wilson*

S1M-3922 Mr John McAllion: United States of America Government Ban on Importation of Glenfiddich Havana Reserve Malt Whiskyâ€”That the Parliament condemns the ban by the Government of the United States of America on the Glenfiddich Havana Reserve single malt entering the United States; notes the absurdity of banning a Scotch malt on the grounds that it is matured in Cuban rum barrels; further notes that this ban highlights the absurdity and iniquity of the oppressive Helms Burton Act that seeks to punish any contact or trade with Cuba, and looks forward to closer links between Scotland and Cuba through trade, tourism and ties of friendship. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Alex Neil, Elaine Smith, Tommy Sheridan, Ms Sandra White, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alasdair Morgan, Robin Harper, Mr Gil Paterson, Susan Deacon, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Donald Gorrie, Andrew Wilson
